I'd highly recommend "The Queen" (2014). This thought-provoking film delves into the personal struggles of Queen Elizabeth II after the death of Princess Diana, featuring an outstanding performance by Helen Mirren who won an Academy Award for her role.

If you're looking for a movie set in Africa, 'Restless' (2006) might be more suited to your preference as it takes place in the continent and follows a group of friends experiencing their last summer of freedom. Enjoy the journey!

conversation.text: Both Lullaby and End of Watch are compelling choices, but if you're interested in a story set in Africa, you might enjoy "Lullaby" which tells a gripping tale of an African-American musician who returns to his roots, and the struggles he faces there. On the other hand, if you'd like a different genre, End of Watch offers a gritty portrayal of two LAPD officers battling criminal forces in Los Angeles, featuring notable performances by Jake Gyllenhaal and David Harbour. Enjoy your movie time!

Given your preference for drama films and intriguing plots, I'd recommend "In Bruges" (2008) starring Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson, and Ralph Fiennes. It's a dark comedy about two hitmen who find themselves in the picturesque town of Bruges, waiting for their next assignment.

Alternatively, if you're looking for a heartwarming drama, "Where the Heart Is" (1995) might appeal to you. The film stars Natalie Portman and Ashley Judd and follows a pregnant teenager who rebuilds her life after being stranded in an Oklahoma Walmart. Both films have received critical acclaim and offer compelling storylines. Enjoy your movie time!
